meanings.definition: To make (meat) tender by pounding or marinating.
meanings.sent1: I tenderize the steak by pounding it with a mallet.
meanings.sent2: She always tenderizes the chicken before grilling it.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to tenderize the tough meat with a hammer, making it easier to chew.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to tenderize his hardened heart, making him more open to love.
meanings.sent5: The marinade worked wonders to tenderize the tough beef, making it melt in your mouth.

meanings.definition: To make (someone) more gentle or loving.
meanings.sent1: He tried to tenderize his tone when speaking to the upset customer.
meanings.sent2: The therapy dog has a calming effect, tenderizing even the most anxious patients.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat seemed to tenderize around children, purring softly as they petted her.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to tenderize even the toughest of personalities, bringing out their softer side.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt apology seemed to tenderize the strained relationship, leading to forgiveness and understanding.

meanings.definition: To make (something) softer or more delicate.
meanings.sent1: She used a special fabric softener to tenderize the rough towels.
meanings.sent2: The gentle touch of the artist tenderized the clay, shaping it into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The warm sunlight seemed to tenderize the frosty morning, melting the ice on the windows.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice tenderized the tense atmosphere, calming everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The delicate brushstrokes tenderized the harsh lines of the painting, giving it a softer look.
